meanings.definition: A type of camera lens that magnifies distant objects.
meanings.sent1: I used a telephoto to capture the moon's craters.
meanings.sent2: The photographer took a stunning telephoto of the mountain peak.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel looked huge through the telephoto lens!
meanings.sent4: Her eyes were like a telephoto, zooming in on every detail.
meanings.sent5: With the telephoto, the landscape seemed within arm's reach.

meanings.definition: A photograph taken with a telephoto lens.
meanings.sent1: The telephoto showed the deer grazing in the meadow.
meanings.sent2: She framed the perfect shot with her telephoto lens.
meanings.sent3: The telephoto image made the tree appear closer than it was.
meanings.sent4: His memory was like a telephoto picture, capturing every moment clearly.
meanings.sent5: Through the telephoto, the details of the flower petals were crystal clear.

meanings.definition: To take a telephoto shot of a bird.
meanings.sent1: I will telephoto the eagle soaring in the sky.
meanings.sent2: She telephotoed the robin perched on the fence.
meanings.sent3: He telephotoed the butterfly, freezing its fluttering wings.
meanings.sent4: The camera telephotoed the bee as it buzzed around the flower.
meanings.sent5: Telephotoing the hummingbird was a challenge due to its speed.
